messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Needing to go to work
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/7/2004 3:24:16 PM Eastern Daylight Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: I was a teacher and may go back to that if need
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/7/2004 3:24:16 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
I was a teacher and may go back to that if need be. It's unfortunate, but it
may happen at some point. I would try other things first.
Thanks.
Teaching classes to homeschoolers in your area - we have lots of teachers in
our area and they hold coop classes. Not boring old reading writing and
'rithmatic but Evirothon, forensics, Anatomy & Physiology, art, Math Olympiads.
Sylvan Learning centers(this one would probably consist of evening hours so
you don't have to miss homeschool activities and an actual paycheck)
Subbing - good if you have someone to watch/play with your little one on
short notice

Here's is what I think about: I like to think of unschooling as "Living life
as if school does not exist" How would I earn money if school was NOT an
option? (For us it isn't)
There are way more choices between the choices of
Unschooling and broke<------>School and regular 9-5 job (or in your case 7:35
- 2:40 LOL)
Elissa


Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you;
They're supposed to help you discover who you are.
~Bernice Johnson Reagon


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
